thread.title: DENTCO Hires New Business Development Manager to Support Growth

author: cnbc.com
title: DENTCO Hires New Business Development Manager to Support Growth
text:
DEWITT, Mich., Feb. 22, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- DENTCO President Scott Milnes announced today they have hired a new Business Development Manager as sales continue to rise during another period of immense growth.
"We are excited to announce Shelley Keller as DENTCO's New Business Development Manager" says National Sales Director, Teresa Phelps. "We are incredibly fortunate to have found someone with her background and work ethic. Having her on the team means great things for DENTCO."
Keller has over 15 years of experience as a proven sales leader in several industries. During her career, clients have praised her warm and consultative approach to help identify challenges and provide solutions.
"What has made DENTCO so successful these past few decades is that we invest in our people. We have more than tripled the amount of office personnel at our headquarters over the last five years, and with Keller, we are poised to continue to expand," says Milnes.
Keller holds a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Accounting from Davenport University and currently lives in Grand Rapids, Michigan where she enjoys keeping fit, fine dining and concerts. She has been highlighted in a national manufacturer's magazine for her sales work and in her spare time won a short story contest sponsored by a local magazine.
DENTCO will be at this years Restaurant Facility Management Association (RFMA) 2018 conference in Phoenix, AZ, March 4-6, as well as SPECS in Dallas, March 18-20, and PRSM in Nashville, April 10-12.
About DENTCO
DENTCO is the 1 st Exterior Services Management Company in the United States. With over 41 years of experience with retail store and facility exteriors, DENTCO offers portfolio management for landscaping, snow and ice control, parking lot maintenance, irrigation, and various other ESM services. Visit www.dentco.com or call (800) 993-3689 for more information.
